result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald Jarod Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: AS TO ALL COUNTS:  Consecutive to each other and any other sentence.  Straight time.
PROBATION REVIEW HEARING AUGUST 21, 2015 AT 1:30 P.M. IN BR. 40.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory Court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived all nonmandatory Court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Court advised defendant that under 48USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

No contact with victim Timothy S. and Aisha S. unless approved by Court or agent, except to convert to No Violent Contact once defendant is back on medication and involved in Mental Health services, further changes per Court or agent.
No contact with firearms.

Batterers Intervention program.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
**Defendant to report to CH 511 and CH 600 within 24 hours or release to enroll in probation and BIP unless waived by agent.

AODA assesssment.  Comply with treatment.  Absolute sobriety.
*Probation conditions apply to all counts/case.

records.addlTxt: Letter to Alisha S.
Letter from Alisha S. regarding no contact order.
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.   rmm
Denying Request to Modify the No Contact Order signed and filed on 6/17/15.  Copies sent to parties.  rmm
Pro se request from defendant to modify no contact order.
Letter in response to request to amend no contact order to no violent contact.
LETTER RECEIVED FROM VICTIM TO HAVE NCO(NO CONTACT ORDER) DROPPED.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Statements by Cathy E.

**Court ordered all counts to be consecutive to each other and any other sentence and to be served straight time.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.
AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.
AS TO COUNT 4
The court sentenced the defendant to 2 MONTHS in the House of Correction.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 30 DAYS (as to each count) as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-Absolute Sobriety.
-AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim Timothy S and Alisha S. unless approved by court or agent., except to convert to No Violent Contact once defendant is back on medication and involved in Mental Health services, further changes per court or agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Defendant to report to CH 511 & CH 600 with in 24 HOURS or release to enroll in Probation and BIP, unless waived by agent.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Defendant Gerald Jarod Evans in court with attorney Alvin Ronald Ugent.  Defendant Gerald Jarod Evans in custody.  Dax Odom for Mike Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 40
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations on a motion of the state, Count 1 was Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNTS 2, 3 & 4
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Case set for plea and sentencing. Court is in trial. Branch 23 agreed to hear the matter. Case sent there forthwith.
Received & Filed, Letter to the court.
Received & Filed, Letter on behalf of defendant.
Received & Filed, Victim Impact Statement.
from Timothy S. received and filed.  rmm

Attorney Alvin Ronald Ugent in court, defendant Gerald Jarod Evans not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gerald Jarod Evans in court with attorney Alvin Ronald Ugent.  Defendant Gerald Jarod Evans in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty on count #1.  All available discovery was turned over to defense counsel, 911 tape is still outstanding, and an offer will be submitted to defense counsel from ADA Schindhelm, per the State.  Case transferred to Branch 40 due to the assignment of ADA Michael Schindhelm.   Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 40 on 4-16-2015 at 1:30 pm.  

Statement made by Alesha S., to modify the no contact order is heard and denied by the Court.   mld

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Timothy S. or Alesha S.

Defendant Gerald Jarod Evans in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Gerald Jarod Evans in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2, 3 & 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
